revisions.rev:
{{Infobox album | Name = Divas of Disco: Live | Type = live | Artist = [[CeCe Peniston]]
[[Thelma Houston]], [[Linda Clifford]]
[[A Taste of Honey (band)|A Taste of Honey]] and [[France Joli]] | Cover = CCP DODL.jpg | Released = February 26, 2010 | Recorded = April 25, 2007 | Genre = [[Dance music]] | Length = 74:33 | Label = Pegasus | Producer = | Reviews = | Misc = {{External music video|type=live|[http://www.dailymotion.com/video/x8xa1v_divas-of-disco_music Divas of Disco - live]}} {{Extra chronology | Artist = [[CeCe Peniston]] | Type = live | Last album = '''''[[CeCe Peniston (EP Live)|EP Live]]'''''
(2007) | This album = '''''Divas of Disco: Live'''''
(2010) | Next album = '''''[[CeCe (album)|CeCe]]'''''
(2011)}} {{Extra chronology | Artist = [[Thelma Houston]] | Type = live | Last album = '''''[[A Woman's Touch]]'''''
(2007) | This album = '''''Divas of Disco: Live'''''
(2010) | Next album = }} {{Singles | Name = Divas of Disco: Live | Type = live | Single 1 = [[CeCe Peniston (EP Live)|EP Live]] | Single 1 date = }} }} {{listen |pos=right | filename = Last Dance.ogg | title = "Last Dance" | format = [[Ogg]] | description = [[CeCe Peniston]] performing live her cover version of the [[Donna Summer]]'s hit from 1978}} ''''' Divas of Disco: Live ''''' is a live album recorded on April 25 in 2007 at Avalon, [[Hollywood]], performed by [[CeCe Peniston]], [[Thelma Houston]], [[Linda Clifford]], [[A Taste of Honey (band)|A Taste Of Honey]] and [[France Joli]], and the whole concert was released also on [[DVD]] already in 2008 on [[ZYX Music]] for [[Europe]], including a bonus material (biographies and backstage interviews with singers[http://www.discogs.com/Linda-Clifford-A-Taste-Of-Honey-Thelma-Houston-France-Joli-CeCe-Peniston-Divas-Of-Disco/release/1950390 'DVD Divas of Disco, Europe, DVD 3136'] Discogs), while in the [[United States]] on RSM Records[http://www.discogs.com/CeCe-Peniston-Thelma-Houston-Linda-Clifford-A-Taste-Of-Honey-France-Joli-Divas-Of-Disco-Live/release/2332936 'DVD Divas of Disco, US, RSMDVD057'] Discogs in 2009. The album included the Peniston two number one hits scored in the [[US Dance]] chart,[http://www.billboard.com/search/?keyword=ce+ce+peniston#/artist/ce-ce-peniston/chart-history/11518?f=359&g=Singles 'CeCe Peniston, US Dance Chart History'] Billboard [[Finally (CeCe Peniston song)|Finally]]" and "[[Keep On Walkin' (song)|Keep On Walkin']]", which charted also in the [[US Hot 100]],[http://www.billboard.com/#/artist/ce-ce-peniston/chart-history/11518 'CeCe Peniston, US Hot 100 Chart History'] Billboard and her cover version of a [[Donna Summer]]'s number three hit from 1978, "[[Last Dance (song)|Last Dance]]". "Keep On Walkin'" (number three in the [[Hot R&B/Hip-Hop Songs|US R&B]][{{Allmusic|class=artist|id=p13924|pure_url=yes}} 'CeCe Peniston, US Chart Positions'] All Music) was also issued as the virtual lead track of the Peniston digital "[[CeCe Peniston (EP Live)|EP Live]]", released by One Media Publishing in 2008.[http://www.technodisco.net/ce-ce-peniston/cece-peniston-1947203.html 'CeCe Peniston, EP Live, One Media Publishing'] In addition, the three track extended play was available also in CDr format since January 14, 2011. == Track listing == {{tracklist | total_length = 74:33 | included additional tracks ("Runaway Love" by [[Linda Clifford]], "Love and Happiness" by [[Thelma Houston]], and "[[Heart to Break the Heart]]" by [[France Joli]]), and the original European edition from 2008 also biographies and backstage interviews with all singers. ===Track listing=== {{tracklist | total_length = 90:52 | extra_column = Performer(s) | writing_credits = yes | title1 = Runaway
